intro: Gastrosiphon ekuamensis, commonly known as the Cameroon bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
